update.description:
This PR is a revision of the `Components` branch which brings some improvements for the names of imported targets. It also introduces some "meta-targets" called `requested` and `all`.

I'm doing this in a separate PR and targeting the `Components` branch for two reasons:

1. To keep terminology consistent, the "main" library is being redubbed the "core" library. This means the function `ign_create_main_library(~)` will now be named `ign_create_core_library(~)`. This breaks the API of the `Components` branch, so I wanted to alert @iche033 and any other current users of Components about this before merging it. I'd rather not do a tic-toc on `ign_create_main_library(~)` since it is not in any release of `ign-cmake` yet.

2. I wanted to make it easier for reviewers to see and understand the stylistic changes that this PR is proposing, and offer feedback in case anyone has a different idea about how to name these targets.

Here's a quick overview of what this PR provides:

* Simpler target names. For example, instead of `ignition-common2::ignition-common2`, a user can simply refer to `ignition-common2::core`:

```
find_package(ignition-common2)

# Old version (still works)
target_link_libraries(foo PUBLIC ignition-common2::ignition-common2)

# New version
target_link_libraries(bar PUBLIC ignition-common2::core)
```

This is even more apparent for library components, e.g. the `graphics` component:

```
find_package(ignition-common2 COMPONENTS graphics)

# Old version (still works)
target_link_libraries(foo PUBLIC ignition-common2::ignition-common2-graphics)

# New version
target_link_libraries(bar PUBLIC ignition-common2::graphics)
```

* A meta-target for requested components, e.g.:

```
find_package(ignition-common2 COMPONENTS graphics av)

# Link to core, graphics, and av all at once:
target_link_libraries(foo PUBLIC ignition-common2::requested)
```

* A meta-target for all components, e.g.:

```
find_package(ignition-common2 COMPONENTS all)

# Link to the core library and all its components:
target_link_libraries(foo PUBLIC ignition-common2::all)
```

I decided to make `::requested` and `::all` separate targets, that way the `::all` target implicitly ensures that all components were searched for, because the `::all` target will not exist unless you specifically request `find_package( ... COMPONENTS all)`.

I appreciate any and all feedback, including any disagreement about the `all` vs `requested` distinction, or alternative names for those targets.
update.title: Nicer imported target names

content.raw:
I tested all three meta targets with ign-rendering, they all work as expected. 

I have no strong preference on whether to use `requested` or `libs`. I'll leave that to you :) but ya we can tweak target names in `Components` PR
content.html:
I tested all three meta targets with ign-rendering, they all work as expected.

I have no strong preference on whether to use requested or libs. I'll leave that to you :) but ya we can tweak target names in Components PR

content.raw:
Yeah, documenting custom modules and config-files for cmake is kind of difficult.

I think the most effective thing we'll be able to do is to have a section on our documentation website with usage examples that can contain an explanation of the different targets and how to use them.
content.html:
Yeah, documenting custom modules and config-files for cmake is kind of difficult.

I think the most effective thing we'll be able to do is to have a section on our documentation website with usage examples that can contain an explanation of the different targets and how to use them.

content.raw:
ah yes sorry I missed that. 

I think what you have in the description of this PR showing the different usage examples is great. Perhaps later on there could be a central place to document this
content.html:
ah yes sorry I missed that.

I think what you have in the description of this PR showing the different usage examples is great. Perhaps later on there could be a central place to document this

content.raw:
If you think `requested` is better, I have no problem sticking with that.

If you're feeling satisfied with this PR and are ready for it to be merged, feel free to merge it in. We can deal with tweaking names in the primary `Components` PR.
content.html:
If you think requested is better, I have no problem sticking with that.

If you're feeling satisfied with this PR and are ready for it to be merged, feel free to merge it in. We can deal with tweaking names in the primary Components PR.

content.raw: ...although admittedly it's hard to tell how the generated files will turn out after they've been configured just from looking at those input files.
content.html: ...although admittedly it's hard to tell how the generated files will turn out after they've been configured just from looking at those input files.

content.raw: The config-files that we generate will contain documentation. You can see it [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/43/nicer-imported-target-names/diff#Lcmake/ignition-config.cmake.inT7) for the core library, [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/43/nicer-imported-target-names/diff#Lcmake/ignition-component-config.cmake.inT8) for components, and [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/43/nicer-imported-target-names/diff#Lcmake/ignition-all-config.cmake.inT8) for `all`.
content.html: The config-files that we generate will contain documentation. You can see it here for the core library, here for components, and here for all.

content.raw:
ya I understood what `requested` means as soon as I saw it without reading your description. I think `libs` could also work as long as it's well documented. 

So maybe we could add some documentation of  these reserved meta-target names and usage examples in the relevant cmake files?
content.html:
ya I understood what requested means as soon as I saw it without reading your description. I think libs could also work as long as it's well documented.

So maybe we could add some documentation of these reserved meta-target names and usage examples in the relevant cmake files?

content.raw: I'm thinking about changing the `::requested` target to `::libs` or something along those lines. It would be less expressive but perhaps more convenient.
content.html: I'm thinking about changing the ::requested target to ::libs or something along those lines. It would be less expressive but perhaps more convenient.

content.raw: Yeah, `all` would be a terrible and deceptive name for an individual component.
content.html: Yeah, all would be a terrible and deceptive name for an individual component.

content.raw:
`ign_create_main_library` to `ign_create_core_library` is a small change so not a problem for ign-rendering.

The meta target idea looks good. I'm going to assume no one is going to name their component `all`
content.html:
ign_create_main_library to ign_create_core_library is a small change so not a problem for ign-rendering.

The meta target idea looks good. I'm going to assume no one is going to name their component all

@iche033 , if you get a chance, please let me know what you think of this PR.

I would go ahead and merge it into the Components branch, but it would very lightly break compatibility with your current branch of ign-rendering that uses components. Specifically, ign_create_main_library(~) would need to be changed to ign_create_core_library(~).

If it would make the transition easier, I could support both function names, but I think you're currently the only one using Components, so I'd rather just eliminate the old function name and replace it with the new one if you're amenable to that.
